perturbation.original_text:
1.1. License. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Licensor hereby grants to Licensee, and Licensee hereby accepts from
Licensor, a personal, non-exclusive, royalty-free right and license to use the Licensed Mark solely and exclusively as a component of Licensee’s
own corporate name and in connection with marketing the investment management, investment consultation and investment advisory services that
Investment Advisor may provide to Licensee. During the term of this Agreement, Licensee shall use the Licensed Mark only to the extent permitted
under this License, and except as provided above, neither Licensee nor any affiliate, owner, director, officer, employee or agent thereof shall
otherwise use the Licensed Mark or any derivative thereof in the Territory without the prior express written consent of Licensor in its sole and
absolute discretion and shall not use the Licensed Mark for any purpose outside the Territory. All rights not expressly granted to Licensee
hereunder shall remain the exclusive property of the Licensor.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.1. License. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Licensor hereby grants to Licensee, and Licensee hereby accepts from
Licensor, a personal, non-exclusive, royalty-free right and license to use the Licensed Mark solely and exclusively as a component of Licensee’s
own corporate name and in connection with marketing the investment management, investment consultation and investment advisory services that
Investment Advisor may provide to Licensee. During the term of this Agreement, Licensee shall use the Licensed Mark only to the extent permitted
under this License, and except as provided above, Licensee nor any affiliate may otherwise use the Licensed Mark or any derivative thereof in the Territory for marketing purposes without the prior express written consent of Licensor but are free to use the Licensed mark for internal documentation. All rights not expressly granted to Licensee
hereunder shall remain the exclusive property of the Licensor.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction. The original text states that 'neither Licensee nor any affiliate' can use the mark without consent. The revised text allows the Licensee and its affiliates to use the Licensed Mark for internal documentation, directly contradicting the broad restriction in the original clause. It is not clear if internal documentation would require written consent or not.

perturbation.original_text:
4.1. Term. This Agreement shall expire if the Investment Advisor or one of its affiliates ceases to serve as investment adviser to the
Licensee. This Agreement shall be terminable by Licensor at any time and in its sole discretion in the event that Licensor or Licensee receives
notice of any Third Party Claim arising out of Licensee’s use of the Licensed Mark; by Licensor or Licensee upon sixty (60) days’ written notice to
the other party; or by Licensee at any time in the event Licensee assigns or attempts to assign or sublicense this Agreement or any of Licensee’s
rights or duties hereunder without the prior written consent of Licensor.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.1. Term. This Agreement shall expire if the Investment Advisor or one of its affiliates ceases to serve as investment adviser to the
Licensee. This Agreement shall be terminable by Licensor at any time and in its sole discretion in the event that Licensor or Licensee receives
notice of any Third Party Claim arising out of Licensee’s use of the Licensed Mark; by Licensor or Licensee upon sixty (60) days’ written notice to
the other party; or by Licensee at any time with no advanced notice. The Licensee can only terminate the agreement if Licensee assigns or attempts to assign or sublicense this Agreement or any of Licensee’s rights or duties hereunder without the prior written consent of Licensor.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a contradiction regarding the conditions under which the Licensee can terminate the agreement. Originally, the Licensee could terminate with 60 days' notice. The modified text states the Licensee can terminate at any time with no advanced notice and adds a condition under which termination can occur. This introduces uncertainty regarding the actual termination procedure, it also does not specify if the Licensee can terminate for any reason or the specified reason.

perturbation.original_text:
5.1. Third Party Beneficiaries. The parties agree that Investment Advisor shall be a third party beneficiary of this Agreement, and shall
have the rights and protections provided to Licensee under this Agreement. Nothing in this Agreement, either express or implied, is intended to or
shall confer upon any third party other than Investment Advisor any legal or equitable right, benefit or remedy of any nature whatsoever under or
by reason of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.1. Third Party Beneficiaries. The parties agree that Investment Advisor shall be a third party beneficiary of this Agreement, and shall
have the rights and protections provided to Licensee under this Agreement. Investment advisor will have access to quarterly reports regarding marketing spend. Nothing in this Agreement, either express or implied, is intended to or
shall confer upon any third party any legal or equitable right, benefit or remedy of any nature whatsoever under or
by reason of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This modification creates a contradiction. The original text explicitly states that only the Investment Advisor is a third-party beneficiary. The addition to quarterly reports appears to be giving another benefit to the investment advisor and not the licensee itself. This is a vague additional protection not laid out in the original text.
